trans-unit.target: Load Balancing for Azure Infrastructure Services

trans-unit.source: Describes the facilities to perform load balancing with Traffic Manager and load balancer.
trans-unit.target: Describes the facilities to perform load balancing with Traffic Manager and load balancer.

trans-unit.source: Load Balancing for Azure Infrastructure Services
trans-unit.target: Load Balancing for Azure Infrastructure Services

trans-unit.source: There are two levels of load balancing available for Azure infrastructure services:
trans-unit.target: There are two levels of load balancing available for Azure infrastructure services:

trans-unit.source: **DNS Level**: Load balancing for traffic to different cloud services located in different data centers, to different Azure websites located in different data centers, or to external endpoints.
trans-unit.target: **DNS Level**: Load balancing for traffic to different cloud services located in different data centers, to different Azure websites located in different data centers, or to external endpoints.

trans-unit.source: This is done with Traffic Manager and the Round Robin load balancing method.
trans-unit.target: This is done with Traffic Manager and the Round Robin load balancing method.

trans-unit.source: **Network Level**: Load balancing of incoming Internet traffic to different virtual machines of a cloud service, or load balancing of traffic between virtual machines in a cloud service or virtual network.
trans-unit.target: **Network Level**: Load balancing of incoming Internet traffic to different virtual machines of a cloud service, or load balancing of traffic between virtual machines in a cloud service or virtual network.

trans-unit.source: This is done with the Azure load balancer.
trans-unit.target: This is done with the Azure load balancer.

trans-unit.source: Traffic Manager load balancing for cloud services and websites
trans-unit.target: Traffic Manager load balancing for cloud services and websites

trans-unit.source: Azure Traffic Manager allows you to control the distribution of user traffic to endpoints, which can include cloud services, websites, external sites, and other Traffic Manager profiles.
trans-unit.target: Azure Traffic Manager allows you to control the distribution of user traffic to endpoints, which can include cloud services, websites, external sites, and other Traffic Manager profiles.

trans-unit.source: Traffic Manager works by applying an intelligent policy engine to Domain Name System (DNS) queries for the domain names of your Internet resources.
trans-unit.target: Traffic Manager works by applying an intelligent policy engine to Domain Name System (DNS) queries for the domain names of your Internet resources.

trans-unit.source: Your cloud services or websites can be running in different datacenters across the world.
trans-unit.target: Your cloud services or websites can be running in different datacenters across the world.

trans-unit.source: You must use either REST or Windows PowerShell to configure external endpoints or Traffic Manager profiles as endpoints.
trans-unit.target: You must use either REST or Windows PowerShell to configure external endpoints or Traffic Manager profiles as endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Azure Traffic Manager uses three load-balancing methods to distribute traffic:
trans-unit.target: Azure Traffic Manager uses three load-balancing methods to distribute traffic:

trans-unit.source: **Failover**: Use this method when you want to use a primary endpoint for all traffic, but provide backups in case the primary becomes unavailable.
trans-unit.target: **Failover**: Use this method when you want to use a primary endpoint for all traffic, but provide backups in case the primary becomes unavailable.

trans-unit.source: **Performance**: Use this method when you have endpoints in different geographic locations and you want requesting clients to use the "closest" endpoint in terms of the lowest latency.
trans-unit.target: **Performance**: Use this method when you have endpoints in different geographic locations and you want requesting clients to use the "closest" endpoint in terms of the lowest latency.

trans-unit.source: **Round Robin:** Use this method when you want to distribute load across a set of cloud services in the same datacenter or across cloud services or websites in different datacenters.
trans-unit.target: **Round Robin:** Use this method when you want to distribute load across a set of cloud services in the same datacenter or across cloud services or websites in different datacenters.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [About Traffic Manager Load Balancing Methods](../traffic-manager/traffic-manager-load-balancing-methods.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [About Traffic Manager Load Balancing Methods](../traffic-manager/traffic-manager-load-balancing-methods.md).

trans-unit.source: The basic process is the following:
trans-unit.target: The basic process is the following:

trans-unit.source: An Internet client queries a domain name corresponding to a web service.
trans-unit.target: An Internet client queries a domain name corresponding to a web service.

trans-unit.source: DNS forwards the name query request to Traffic Manager.
trans-unit.target: DNS forwards the name query request to Traffic Manager.

trans-unit.source: Traffic Manager sends back the DNS name of the cloud service in the round robin list.
trans-unit.target: Traffic Manager sends back the DNS name of the cloud service in the round robin list.

trans-unit.source: The Internet client's DNS server resolves the name to an IP address and sends it to the Internet client.
trans-unit.target: The Internet client's DNS server resolves the name to an IP address and sends it to the Internet client.

trans-unit.source: The Internet client connects with the chosen cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The Internet client connects with the chosen cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Azure load balancing for virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Azure load balancing for virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines in the same cloud service or virtual network can communicate with each other directly using their private IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines in the same cloud service or virtual network can communicate with each other directly using their private IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: Computers and services outside the cloud service or virtual network can only communicate with virtual machines in a cloud service or virtual network with a configured endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Computers and services outside the cloud service or virtual network can only communicate with virtual machines in a cloud service or virtual network with a configured endpoint.

trans-unit.source: An endpoint is a mapping of a public IP address and port to that private IP address and port of a virtual machine or web role within an Azure cloud service.
trans-unit.target: An endpoint is a mapping of a public IP address and port to that private IP address and port of a virtual machine or web role within an Azure cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Load Balancer randomly distributes a specific type of incoming traffic across multiple virtual machines or services in a configuration known as a load-balanced set.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Load Balancer randomly distributes a specific type of incoming traffic across multiple virtual machines or services in a configuration known as a load-balanced set.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can spread the load of web request traffic across multiple web servers or web roles.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can spread the load of web request traffic across multiple web servers or web roles.

trans-unit.source: Azure can also load balance within a cloud service or virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Azure can also load balance within a cloud service or virtual network.

trans-unit.source: This is known as internal load balancing and can be used in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: This is known as internal load balancing and can be used in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: To load balance between servers in different tiers of a multi-tier application (for example, between web and database tiers).
trans-unit.target: To load balance between servers in different tiers of a multi-tier application (for example, between web and database tiers).

trans-unit.source: Load balancing for line-of-business (LOB) applications hosted in Azure without requiring additional load balancer hardware or software.
trans-unit.target: Load balancing for line-of-business (LOB) applications hosted in Azure without requiring additional load balancer hardware or software.

trans-unit.source: Including on-premises servers in the set of computers whose traffic that is load balanced.
trans-unit.target: Including on-premises servers in the set of computers whose traffic that is load balanced.

trans-unit.source: Similar to Azure load balancing, internal load balancing is facilitated by configuring an internal load-balanced set.
trans-unit.target: Similar to Azure load balancing, internal load balancing is facilitated by configuring an internal load-balanced set.
